Content: The <color=#57f0fb>battle target</color> of this region is displayed here.

Name: Rosetta
Content: You must meet the <color=#57f0fb>Development Level required</color> before challenging the battle target.

Name: Rosetta
Content: The challenge has a time limit. You must complete it <color=#57f0fb>within the designated number of days</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: The timeline also displays the remaining days.

Name: Rosetta
Content: At the end of every day, all three resources will be reset to 0 and converted into <color=#57f0fb>Development Level</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: <color=#57f0fb>You can take three actions every day</color>. Once your Action Points reach 0, you must rest. After resting, the time will advance to <color=#57f0fb>the next day, and Action Points will be fully restored</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: You have used all Action Points for today. Tap to rest.

Name: Rosetta
Content: ...Hmm, this helps us understand the strength difference between us and the enemy.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Otherwise, the Garrison Point will <color=#57f0fb>lose Defense Points continuously</color>. Once the Defense Points drop to 0, the mission will fail.

Name: Rosetta
Content: You can also view the battle target on the map.

Name: Rosetta
Content: The Development Level equals the sum of the Development Rate of all three colors.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Colored resources will be reset after daily results are calculated.

Name: Rosetta
Content: During rest, colored resources are multiplied by their corresponding multipliers and added to the Development Rate of the color. The daily <color=#57f0fb>growth</color> of Development Rate is shown here.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Note that color multipliers will not be reset. Recruit more members to increase the color multipliers.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Use Registration Forms to recruit combat members.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Combat members provide different levels of <color=#57f0fb>color multipliers</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: At the end of every day, color multipliers will be <color=#57f0fb>multiplied</color> to colored resources, contributing to their respective Development Rate.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Once chosen, color multipliers will <color=#57f0fb>stack permanently</color>, so make your choice carefully.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Select any combat member to recruit.

Name: Rosetta
Content: We are about to engage in a battle against Corrupted in the area ahead. Tap to view the battle information.

Name: Rosetta
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Engaging in a battle consumes Action Points</color>. Make sure you are well-prepared before starting the battle!

Name: Celica
Content: Welcome to the <color=#57f0fb>Trial of Simulacrums</color>. Babylonia has digitized powerful enemies you fought in the past into a training system.

Name: Celica
Content: You can select enemies and materialize them for training purposes.

Name: Celica
Content: In this trial, enemies have different abilities than their original versions. Tap the button to <color=#57f0fb>switch</color> and view their abilities.

Name: Celica
Content: Some abilities can be practiced individually. Tap <color=#57f0fb>Practice</color> to enter the training stages for specific abilities.

Name: Celica
Content: Before entering the trial, go through the tutorial stages to understand the differences between this trial and regular challenges.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap to enter the tutorial.

Name: Celica
Content: During trials, characters can utilize unique talents, which are unlocked by completing the trial challenges.

Name: Celica
Content: Let's start with the tutorial battle.

Name: Celica
Content: Each character will activate a fixed, powerful talent.

Name: Celica
Content: In addition, you can use specific characters to challenge the trial and <color=#57f0fb>earn Trial Rating</color> to unlock bonus optional talents.

Name: Rosetta
Content: You must reach a certain Development Level to challenge the battle target in the region.

Name: Rosetta
Content: If your Development Level is too low, consider going through other unexplored areas first and using multiple methods to strengthen your forces.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Apart from boosting the Development Level, the resources obtained through exploration can also be used in <color=#57f0fb>Camp Support</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Tap the left panel to view the support effects provided by the members in the camp.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Within the same branch, different nodes provide different Camp Support effects. <color=#57f0fb>Explore corresponding colored areas to unlock powerful Camp Support effects</color>!

Name: Rosetta
Content: Camp Support has three branches. <color=#57f0fb>Explore areas of corresponding colors to obtain the respective resources</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: The total Support Points and progress of the current branch are shown here.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Once you have defeated the battle target of the region, you may enter the next region.

Name: Rosetta
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Challenging the battle target does not consume Action Points.</color> Let's go!

Name: Rosetta
Content: Buildings provide powerful combat bonuses. Tap here for more details.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Construction Permits are required to construct buildings. <color=#57f0fb>1 Construction Permit is granted every day during the daily results calculation</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Increase the Infrastructure Support Level to unlock more powerful buildings.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Additionally, you will also receive New Sophiasburgh Coins during the daily results calculation. <color=#57f0fb>Every 10 New Sophiasburgh Coins grant 1 point of interest bonus</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Strengthen your forces in various ways and progress toward the regional battle target!

Name: Rosetta
Content: Tap the Garrison Point to view detailed information about interest rates.

Name: Celica
Content: New <color=#57f0fb>basic abilities</color> and <color=#57f0fb>Connection Enhanced effects</color> have been added to the Abyssal Mountain Mine in this update.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap here to view the <color=#57f0fb>basic abilities</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: During battles, enemies will <color=#57f0fb>accumulate energy and become enhanced</color>. Keep an eye on their status and adjust your attack strategies accordingly.

Name: Teddy
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>Wreck-It Froggie</color>, Commandant.

Name: Teddy
Content: Let's start with Lamia.

Name: Teddy
Content: Go ahead and select a stage to enter.

Name: Teddy
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>turn limit</color> of the current stage is displayed here.

Name: Teddy
Content: You can check the <color=#57f0fb>item types</color> that may randomly drop in the stage.

Name: Teddy
Content: Alright, let's start the challenge.

Name: Teddy
Content: When selecting a square, if it has space to the <color=#57f0fb>left or right</color>, you can move it <color=#57f0fb>horizontally</color>.

Name: Teddy
Content: If there is an open space below that is at least the length of the square, the square will <color=#57f0fb>automatically fall down</color>. If the square <color=#57f0fb>fills up</color> the entire row, it will be automatically cleared, granting you points.

Name: Teddy
Content: After every turn, all cubes will <color=#57f0fb>move upward</color>. You can check the <color=#57f0fb>preview</color> of the upcoming row layout here.

Name: Teddy
Content: When the cubes <color=#57f0fb>stack over the top</color> of the board, the stage will end as well.

Name: Teddy
Content: Clear as many squares as you can and challenge the high score!

Name: Teddy
Content: Tap here to view the <color=#57f0fb>new</color> features and other tutorials.

Name: Teddy
Content: When a square preview appears at the <color=#57f0fb>top</color>, a block of the displayed type will appear and <color=#57f0fb>fall</color> to the top of the existing squares after your move.

Name: Celica
Content: In this Guild Expedition, once the <color=#57f0fb>Cliff Fortress</color> is defeated, a <color=#57f0fb>Siege Engine</color> will be dispatched to assist you.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap the Siege Engine to view its <color=#57f0fb>detailed information</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: The current <color=#57f0fb>HP</color> of the Siege Engine is shown here.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Supporting the Siege Engine</color> increases its <color=#57f0fb>HP</color>. Each support consumes <color=#57f0fb>20 Supplies</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap the button to <color=#57f0fb>support the Siege Engine</color>. Each Siege Engine can only be <color=#57f0fb>supported once</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: After the Siege Engine <color=#57f0fb>attacks a node</color>, the supporting player will earn the <color=#57f0fb>max possible points</color> for clearing the node once.

Name: Celica
Content: When the Siege Engine is defeated, its <color=#57f0fb>enhancements</color> will be carried forward to the node, granting all the players attacking the node the same <color=#57f0fb>enhancements</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>After School</color>, Commandant.

Name: Yata
Content: In this event, you will need to collect School Supplies from three areas. Let's start with the <color=#57f0fb>Study Room</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Let's first learn how to collect supplies.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap <color=#57f0fb>[Start Sorting]</color> to enter Chapter I.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap the button to <color=#57f0fb>confirm collection</color> of supplies.

Name: Yata
Content: Press and hold to drag supplies into the <color=#57f0fb>available space</color> in the backpack.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap here to add supplies to the backpack.

Name: Yata
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Collection completed</color>. Tap the button to see the results.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap the button to <color=#57f0fb>confirm collection</color> of supplies.

Name: Yata
Content: The grids that need protection will have <color=#57f0fb>special indicators</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Some supplies are very fragile and require <color=#57f0fb>Paddings</color> to protect their <color=#57f0fb>fragile parts</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Put Paddings</color> in the protection grids to ensure the supply is collected intact. Unprotected supplies <color=#57f0fb>will not yield Achievement Points</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Placing <color=#57f0fb>two</color> supplies of the same color increases the Achievement Points earned from this color by 50%. If there are <color=#57f0fb>three or more</color> supplies of the same color, the Achievement Points of this color are increased by 75%.

Name: Yata
Content: Collecting supplies <color=#57f0fb>of the same color</color> grants extra Achievement Points.

Name: Celica
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>Surviving Samsara</color>, Commandant.

Name: Celica
Content: In each chapter, you will need to use a single team to <color=#57f0fb>challenge three enemies consecutively</color>, with each enemy having a unique affix.

Name: Celica
Content: This challenge consists of 3 chapters. In each chapter, you will need to use a single team to <color=#57f0fb>challenge three enemies consecutively</color>. Let's start with the first chapter.

Name: Celica
Content: Before starting, you need to select a <color=#57f0fb>Chapter Weakness</color> to design your combat strategy around it.

Name: Celica
Content: Once chosen, the weakness <color=#57f0fb>cannot be changed</color> during the challenge. Let's go.

Name: Celica
Content: All affixes will <color=#57f0fb>carry over to subsequent battles</color>. Tap here to view them.

Name: Celica
Content: After defeating the enemy, you must assign a character to <color=#57f0fb>station</color>. Stationed characters <color=#57f0fb>cannot participate in subsequent battles</color> but will provide a powerful <color=#57f0fb>bonus</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: In this chapter, you can choose <color=#57f0fb>any three</color> of the six enemies to challenge.

Name: Celica
Content: Each battle has <color=#57f0fb>independent difficulty levels</color>. You may choose any difficulty to challenge.

Name: Celica
Content: Each enemy has 4 difficulty levels. You must <color=#57f0fb>clear or auto-clear</color> a difficulty level to unlock the next one.

Name: Celica
Content: Each difficulty level has corresponding <color=#57f0fb>points</color> and <color=#57f0fb>bonus affixes</color>. Choose wisely to earn a higher score.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Boss enemies</color> have a <color=#57f0fb>special ability</color> that they <color=#57f0fb>will use to enhance other enemies</color> in subsequent battles.

Name: Celica
Content: After <color=#57f0fb>completing a chapter</color>, you can claim great mission rewards.

Name: Yata
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>Hydrangea Gala</color>, Commandant.

Name: Yata
Content: This event consists of <color=#57f0fb>2 chapters: Blossom Seer and Sunset Visit</color>, which unlock at different times. Select the <color=#57f0fb>Blossom Seer</color> chapter now.

Name: Yata
Content: Where should we start...? First, let's go over the basics of block placement.

Name: Yata
Content: Select the first block.

Name: Yata
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Drag and drop</color> the Red Arcade Machine to the highlighted area.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap confirm to complete.

Name: Yata
Content: Blocks of the same color will connect and form a larger block.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap <color=#57f0fb>Score Mode</color> to view the current score.

Name: Yata
Content: Look at the current visitor flow pattern... Looks like they won't pass through the area we set up at all.

Name: Yata
Content: In this case, we need to play some tricks.

Name: Yata
Content: First, put the Red Arcade Machine here.

Name: Yata
Content: Next, rotate it to block the path.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap to confirm. Done!

Name: Commandant
Content: That was a bit crude... Speaking of which, I noticed a special vendor here.

Name: Yata
Content: This is the Oden Store, selling Misono High's unique snacks. If it were me, I might <color=#57f0fb>take a detour just to grab a bite there</color>.

Name: Commandant
Content: I'll place it in the festival area too.

Name: Commandant
Content: If I put it here, it might block the visitors' path...

Name: Commandant
Content: Tap the previously placed Arcade Machine to reposition it to avoid blocking the path.

Name: Commandant
Content: Let's put it here instead.

Name: Yata
Content: If someone wants to eat Oden, they'll have to take a detour, right? ...You are a business genius.

Name: Yata
Content: If a character's favorite special block is present, they will prioritize going there.

Name: Yata
Content: As the character heads to <color=#57f0fb>their favorite special block, all the blocks they pass on the way will grant special points again</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Let the festival begin once you are ready.

Name: Yata
Content: The festival visitors will start from here.

Name: Yata
Content: Now, visitors will pass the blocks we have placed.

Name: Commandant
Content: Place special blocks next.

Name: Yata
Content: It seems the visitors have not noticed the room above.

Name: Yata
Content: Continue placing blocks to aim for a higher score!

Name: Yata
Content: Tap a game block.

Name: Yata
Content: Select the Blue Arcade Machine.

Name: Yata
Content: Place the blocks strategically <color=#57f0fb>to change the visitor's routes</color> and achieve a higher festival score.

Name: Yata
Content: What a crowded room. I don't think the visitors would want to go in.

Name: Yata
Content: Confirm placement.

Name: Yata
Content: Select a <color=#57f0fb>special block</color> to the character's liking.

Name: Yata
Content: Place it in the right location.

Name: Yata
Content: If a character's favorite <color=#57f0fb>special block</color> is present, they will <color=#57f0fb>prioritize going there even if they have to take a detour</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: As the character heads to <color=#57f0fb>the special block, all the blocks they pass on the way will grant special points again</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Different characters prefer different special blocks. <color=#57f0fb>When they go through their preferred special blocks, exclusive stories will be unlocked</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Now that visitors have been attracted to the special block, place the remaining blocks to increase your festival score!

Name: Yata
Content: There will be a performance on the <color=#57f0fb>stage</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Once the stage is placed, it becomes the new <color=#57f0fb>ending point</color>.

Name: Yata
Content: Tap the Flower block.

Name: Yata
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>special rules</color> of blocks can be viewed here.

Name: Yata
Content: Let's aim for a higher score—wait, did that statue just move?

Name: Yata
Content: I remember hearing similar stories in Misono High —"The Seven Misono Mysteries".

Name: Yata
Content: If a statue is surrounded by many students, it would suddenly move on its own... something along the lines of that.

Name: Yata
Content: Mystery and the festival together... that sounds like a great attraction.

Name: Yata
Content: It is said that if a <color=#57f0fb>"Mystery" block is adjacent to a block of 10 or above, once the character passes through the Mystery block</color>, something amazing will happen.

Name: Yata
Content: Different festival venues have different scoring rules.

Name: Yata
Content: Follow the rules and aim for an even higher score!

Name: Yata
Content: In addition, different characters also have different preferred special blocks. <color=#57f0fb>Completing the festival with a character will unlock their exclusive stories.</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: In the <color=#57f0fb>first two battles</color> of Chapter 3, you can use <color=#57f0fb>Auto Clear</color> after meeting the specific conditions.

Name: Celica
Content: To <color=#57f0fb>activate Auto Clear</color>, the following conditions must be satisfied: \nClear <color=#57f0fb>the selected enemy for the first time</color>;\nReach a <color=#57f0fb>specific total score under the corresponding difficulty</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: Once all conditions are satisfied, tap <color=#57f0fb>Auto Clear</color> to automatically clear the current stage.

Name: Yata
Content: Let's take a look at the festival venue first.

Name: Nanami
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>Stellar Witching Hour</color>. This time, you will join Nanami to simulate different possible futures. Let's try a simulation first.

Name: Nanami
Content: In different futures, you will receive <color=#57f0fb>different Add-ons</color>. These Add-ons will change how characters are used, assisting you in simulations.

Name: Nanami
Content: Let's roll, Commandant!

Name: Nanami
Content: After clearing a Dimension Domain, <color=#57f0fb>the dropped Add-ons</color> must be <color=#57f0fb>equipped</color> to characters to take effect. Let's try equipping an Add-on.

Name: Nanami
Content: Tap here to equip a character with an Add-on.

Name: Nanami
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Tap</color> an Add-on from the list to equip it.

Name: Nanami
Content: To <color=#57f0fb>unequip</color> an Add-on, you must select the currently equipped Add-on first.

Name: Nanami
Content: Then tap <color=#57f0fb>Unequip</color>.

Name: Nanami
Content: You can also use the <color=#57f0fb>Recommended</color> feature to automatically select Add-ons and equip them.

Name: Nanami
Content: Bear in mind that each character has their own <color=#57f0fb>load limit</color>. Characters with no load capacity left cannot equip more Add-ons.

Name: Nanami
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>load</color> required to equip the Add-on is displayed here.

Name: Nanami
Content: Characters' <color=#57f0fb>load</color> capacity will <color=#57f0fb>increase</color> as you progress through the simulation.

Name: Nanami
Content: Commandant, here are some other useful features you should know.

Name: Nanami
Content: Here at "Big Eater", you can perform Cloud Replay <color=#57f0fb>once</color> <color=#57f0fb>per day</color> to get Add-on rewards immediately.

Name: Nanami
Content: When <color=#57f0fb>Hyperspace energy reaches 100%</color>, you can enter a Hyperspace Singularity and obtain <color=#57f0fb>many Add-ons</color> after challenging it.

Name: Nanami
Content: Once you have collected a certain number of Add-ons, you can enhance them in <color=#57f0fb>Wanderer's Guide</color>.

Name: Nanami
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Collect the required number of Add-ons of the specific star level</color> to activate the corresponding enhancements.

Name: Nanami
Content: Tap here to view a summary of all <color=#57f0fb>active</color> Wanderer's Guide enhancements.

Name: Nanami
Content: In <color=#57f0fb>Add-on Codex</color>, you can <color=#57f0fb>purchase</color> Add-ons that may drop from the cleared stages.

Name: Nanami
Content: Select an Add-on.

Name: Nanami
Content: Use <color=#57f0fb>Simulation Crystal Flux</color> to <color=#57f0fb>unlock</color> the selected Add-on.

Name: Nanami
Content: Each Add-on star level has five enhancements. Tap to view details.

Name: Nanami
Content: Here, you can <color=#57f0fb>adjust how enhancement points</color> are allocated. All enhancements have the same limit, which increases as you progress through the simulation.

Name: Nanami
Content: After adjusting, tap <color=#57f0fb>Confirm & Save</color> to apply the changes.

Name: Nanami
Content: Tap here to save the current setup as a <color=#57f0fb>template</color>. You can quickly switch between setups by applying templates.

Name: Nanami
Content: Here's another way to power you up, Commandant! Use the <color=#57f0fb>Simulation Crystal Flux</color> obtained from battles to enhance <color=#57f0fb>the entire team's stats</color>!

Name: Nanami
Content: Each type of enhancement has a <color=#57f0fb>special stat</color> that can assist you in further exploration.

Name: Nanami
Content: Once the enhancement has reached <color=#57f0fb>the required level</color>, the special stat will be unlocked.

Name: Nanami
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>Cosmic Odyssey</color>, Commandant.

Name: Nanami
Content: In this event, you will need to help Nanami gather the supplies required for interstellar travel. Let's <color=#57f0fb>begin our journey</color>!

Name: Nanami
Content: First, let's start with the basics!

Name: Nanami
Content: Tap <color=#57f0fb>Start</color> to enter the first stage.

Name: Nanami
Content: Swipe across the board to move the <color=#57f0fb>Supply Blocks</color>. Two identical blocks can be <color=#57f0fb>merged</color> into a higher-tier block.

Name: Nanami
Content: Once a Supply Block reaches <color=#57f0fb>Lv.16</color>, it and all adjacent blocks in a cross pattern will be <color=#57f0fb>cleared</color>. Their <color=#57f0fb>points will be added</color> to your score.

Name: Nanami
Content: Try to merge as many Lv.16 blocks as possible within the limited moves!

Name: Nanami
Content: When multiple identical blocks appear together, <color=#57f0fb>combo merge</color> can be triggered. Let's move them into the same row first.

Name: Nanami
Content: Swipe horizontally now to perform a <color=#57f0fb>combo merge</color> and instantly get a Lv.16 block.

Name: Nanami
Content: During exploration, you may also come across <color=#57f0fb>Energy Meteorites</color>. They cannot move but will block the movement of Supply Blocks.

Name: Nanami
Content: But don't worry! Each time an <color=#57f0fb>Energy Meteorite</color> blocks another block's movement, it will lose 1 durability, and will shatter when its durability drops to 0.

Name: Nanami
Content: During your journey, various items will be unlocked to help Nanami collect supplies.

Name: Nanami
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Replica</color> allows you to copy the block with the highest points on the board. Use it to resolve the problem!

Name: Nanami
Content: When a Lv.16 block comes into contact with Energy Meteorites, it will shatter them directly and <color=#57f0fb>charge up</color> your items. Use this feature wisely.

Name: Nanami
Content: When a Lv.16 block is created, it will activate adjacent <color=#57f0fb>"Cleaners""""</color>. Activated """"Cleaners" will <color=#57f0fb>clear</color> their adjacent blocks.

Name: Nanami
Content: Nanami's new ability, <color=#57f0fb>Phaseshift</color>, can swap any two blocks or move a block to a designated empty space.

Name: Nanami
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Space Thunderstorm</color> targets high-level Supply Blocks and will reduce them to the lowest level in the next turn.

Name: Nanami
Content: When you see a thunderstorm warning, quickly relocate the high-level Supply Block in this grid.

Name: Celica
Content: To accommodate the habits of different players, Shadow Strike can be triggered in two ways. Tap this button to <color=#57f0fb>switch the skill input mode</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: The second method is to <color=#57f0fb>press and hold Basic Attack</color>. While casting Leaping Thrust, holding Basic Attack will automatically activate Shadow Strike.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>During Shadow Strike, you can press and hold Basic Attack or tap it continuously to automatically ping special orbs.</color>

Name: Celica
Content: Still, after a motorcycle combo attack, you still need to manually ping the special orb to activate Shadow Strike.

Name: Celica
Content: The first method is the conventional approach, where players can <color=#57f0fb>ping special orbs</color> to enter Shadow Strike.

Name: Celica
Content: While casting Leaping Thrust, <color=#57f0fb>Red and Yellow Orbs are converted into special orbs. Ping the special orbs manually to activate Shadow Strike</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: After activating Shadow Strike, you can also press and hold Basic Attack or tap it continuously to ping special orbs.

Name: Celica
Content: Pressing and holding Basic Attack makes the entire process smoother. It is <color=#57f0fb>recommended for players who prefer Darkflow-related attacks</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: This method prevents you from accidentally pressing and holding buttons during Lightning-focused attacks, and is <color=#57f0fb>recommended for Lightning-focused play styles</color>.

Name: Nanami
Content: We have unlocked <color=#57f0fb>Infinite Challenge</color>. In <color=#57f0fb>Infinite Challenge</color>, there is no move limit or score goal.

Name: Nanami
Content: However, the difficulty increases as you take more moves, allowing you to challenge yourself and set new records.

Name: Nanami
Content: Commandant, you might have already noticed that 6-star Add-ons have a unique Quantum Affix system.

Name: Nanami
Content: Tap here to unlock the Quantum Affix.

Name: Nanami
Content: You can consume Simulation Crystal Flux to unlock the Quantum Affix or reset already unlocked affixes.

Name: Nanami
Content: You must complete all Dimension Domains to complete a simulation.

Name: Nanami
Content: If you fail a challenge, Nanami will save your progress, so you can continue from where you left off when you challenge again. Take care, Commandant!

Name: Nanami
Content: Let's enter the Dimension Domain.

Name: Nanami
Content: Each simulation has different Add-on <color=#57f0fb>drop rates</color>. You will also get <color=#57f0fb>First-Clear Add-on</color> after clearing some stages. I'll leave the rest to you, Commandant!

Name: Celica
Content: Commandant, your <color=#57f0fb>S-Rank Choice Pack</color> has been stored in the Items.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap Items.

Name: Celica
Content: Open the Item interface.

Name: Celica
Content: Select the S-Rank Choice Pack.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap on the pack to use it.

Name: Celica
Content: Commandant, your <color=#57f0fb>S-Rank Choice Pack</color> has been stored in the Items.

Name: Nanami
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Upgrade</color> your Main City now, Commandant!

Name: Nanami
Content: This is the <color=#57f0fb>Main City</color>. Our journey starts here!

Name: Nanami
Content: We can't have an empty Main City. Behold, Nanami's <color=#57f0fb>upgrading</color> magic—

Name: Nanami
Content: Commandant, Nanami just found a new game——<color=#57f0fb>Spice and Salt</color>! Come play it with Nanami!

Name: Nanami
Content: Don't worry if you don't know how to play it! Nanami will guide you through the tutorial!

Name: Nanami
Content: Tap here to begin.

Name: Nanami
Content: Each stage has a set number of <color=#57f0fb>required quarters</color>. Clear the stage and gain 1st Clear Rewards by completing the required number of quarters.

Name: Nanami
Content: Completing <color=#57f0fb>Challenge Goals</color> will grant one-time rewards.

Name: Nanami
Content: Let's begin!

Name: Nanami
Content: Hoho, that's more like it! Now that the <color=#57f0fb>Main City is upgraded</color>, there are blocks that <color=#57f0fb>we can explore</color>!

Name: Nanami
Content: By the way, you should have also noticed that there are <color=#57f0fb>areas we can purchase</color>. We should purchase it ASAP!

Name: Nanami
Content: Unfortunately, we don't have enough Golden Shells yet. Let's see if we can find anything nice from exploration! <color=#57f0fb>Exploring has no cost</color>.

Name: Nanami
Content: Oops, still not enough Golden Shells. Let's check out <color=#57f0fb>Quarter Planning</color> then!

Name: Nanami
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>Productivity</color> is shown here. You can allocate it to produce <color=#57f0fb>three types of goods</color>. Nanami suggests producing a bit of <color=#57f0fb>each type of good</color>!

Name: Nanami
Content: Well, we only have 1 Productivity anyway. Let's produce <color=#57f0fb>coconuts</color>!

Name: Nanami
Content: Nanami has secretly increased the <color=#57f0fb>price</color> of coconuts!

Name: Nanami
Content: After allocating Productivity, you can see the <color=#57f0fb>estimated income</color>.

Name: Nanami
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>total income</color> is displayed here.

Name: Nanami
Content: Speaking of which, we just got some coconuts from our exploration. Let's <color=#57f0fb>sell</color> them now!

Name: Nanami
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Sell</color> all of them!

Name: Nanami
Content: Now we should have enough Golden Shells. Let's take a break!

Name: Nanami
Content: Come on, Commandant! We can purchase a <color=#57f0fb>new area</color>!

Name: Nanami
Content: This area contains a <color=#57f0fb>city</color>. Once you purchase it, you can gain its bonus!

Name: Nanami
Content: Here are more blocks we can explore. Let's check out the <color=#57f0fb>city missions</color> first!

Name: Nanami
Content: Coco-nice! The price of <color=#57f0fb>coconuts</color> has increased!

Name: Nanami
Content: Cities will also issue <color=#57f0fb>city missions</color>. Complete them to further increase the city bonuses!

Name: Nanami
Content: Commandant, have you noticed this? You can get <color=#57f0fb>Merchant EXP</color> from <color=#57f0fb>buying areas</color> and <color=#57f0fb>upgrading cities</color>!

Name: Nanami
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Upgrade the Main City</color> to get more Productivity and unlock new areas to purchase! This is important, don't forget!

Name: Changyu
Content: Commandant, we can <color=#57f0fb>construct buildings</color> now.

Name: Changyu
Content: To construct a building, we need a <color=#57f0fb>block</color>, a <color=#57f0fb>Building Blueprint</color>, and Golden Shells. This is a block we can build upon. Don't miss out on such blocks during exploration.

Name: Changyu
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Building Blueprints</color> are mainly obtained through <color=#57f0fb>upgrading the Main City</color>. As for the Golden Shells... they're on me this time!

Name: Changyu
Content: Once constructed, Buildings can provide you with continuous benefits. Let's build it now!

Name: Leonie
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>Operation SimTerra</color>, Commandant. In this event, you will be directly involved in battles.

Name: Leonie
Content: Tap here to learn more about the rules of "Earth Simulation 3.0 Prototype."

Name: Leonie
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Auto-aim</color> is available for this operation.\nWhen you see the lock-on button, simply tap and hold to activate auto-aim.

Name: Leonie
Content: In "Others"""", change the lock-on setting to <color=#57f0fb>Advanced/Manual</color>. \nThen check the <color=#57f0fb>""""Show Lock-on Button"</color> box!

Name: Leonie
Content: Tap here to view the weapon details.

Name: Leonie
Content: Different weapons provide various types of effects. Choose the most appropriate weapon based on the combat situation for optimal performance!

Name: Leonie
Content: Adjust the parameters to find the settings that best suit your playstyle!

Name: Leonie
Content: Here, you can adjust the sensitivity based on your preferences.

Name: Celica
Content: Thunderbolt Manual unlocked.

Name: Celica
Content: Complete Phase 1 missions to obtain the powerful S-Rank Character <color=#57f0fb>Lucia: Crimson Weave</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap to view Phase 1 Missions.

Name: Celica
Content: Complete Chapter 1 to finish the mission.

Name: Celica
Content: Now, let's continue the Main Story!

Name: Celica
Content: Welcome to Layout Settings. <color=#57f0fb>Press and hold</color> a module to drag it to your preferred location.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Double tap</color> on any module to configure its visibility, size, opacity, etc.

Name: Celica
Content: Welcome to Layout Settings. <color=#57f0fb>Press and hold</color> a module to drag it to your preferred location.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Double tap</color> on any module to configure its visibility, size, opacity, etc.

Name: Celica
Content: Commandant, your Personal Manual has been moved to <color=#57f0fb>events</color>. Please access it from there.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Mindscape Pact</color> has started.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Mindscape Pact</color> consists of two components that provide characters with <color=#57f0fb>permanent bonuses</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Border Pact</color> can permanently increase characters' <color=#57f0fb>skill levels</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Sequence Pact</color> can permanently increase characters' <color=#57f0fb>Extra DMG Bonus</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: Commandant, please attack and occupy Port Kyaranta.

Name: Celica
Content: After occupying a stronghold, station a character in it to receive the corresponding bonus.

Name: Celica
Content: This area has been occupied by enemy forces. You can choose <color=#57f0fb>Stationing</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>A team member to be stationed</color> needs to meet the following requirements.

Name: Celica
Content: After assigning stationed members, <color=#57f0fb>Stationing Effects</color> will be triggered.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap here to select or switch the stationing members.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Check Research</color> is available.

Name: Celica
Content: You may check an <color=#57f0fb>S-Rank character</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: After completing the check, you have a <color=#57f0fb>100%</color> chance to obtain the checked character when you get an S-Rank character, and the character is <color=#57f0fb>guaranteed within 40 Research attempts</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: Check Research only works for <color=#57f0fb>1</color> character, so make your choice carefully.

Name: Changyu
Content: Commandant, the Coconut Workshop you built has produced additional <color=#57f0fb>coconuts</color>. Tap here to claim them.

Name: Changyu
Content: Don't forget to claim the additional production from the Coconut Workshop every round! Other buildings have their functions too, so keep making them whenever you see <color=#57f0fb>blocks that you can construct buildings upon</color>.

Name: Changyu
Content: Here's another secret tip to help you make more Golden Shells, Commandant.

Name: Changyu
Content: Factors like production efficiency, selling price, and fluctuation will impact your <color=#57f0fb>Item Rating</color>.

Name: Changyu
Content: If you don't have a production plan yet, I suggest you check the current <color=#57f0fb>Item Rating</color> for ideas.

Name: Changyu
Content: Commandant, we have unlocked additional <color=#57f0fb>Productivity</color> after upgrading the Main City.

Name: Changyu
Content: You may have already discovered that the <color=#57f0fb>production quantity</color> bonus provided by every point of <color=#57f0fb>Productivity</color> differs, even for <color=#57f0fb>the same item</color>.

Name: Changyu
Content: Generally speaking, when you first allocate <color=#57f0fb>Productivity</color> for an item, it will generate higher revenue than when you invest Productivity in this item again later.

Name: Changyu
Content: If you are having trouble deciding the Productivity allocation, you may seek suggestions from the <color=#57f0fb>estimated total income</color>!

Name: Changyu
Content: Therefore, I suggest you experiment with different combinations and expand your product range.

Name: Changyu
Content: Commandant, you had a <color=#57f0fb>Critical Sale</color> in the last transaction!

Name: Changyu
Content: What's a critical sale? Both production and sales have a chance to be <color=#57f0fb>critical</color>. When a critical is triggered, you will receive lots of bonus benefits based on the corresponding <color=#57f0fb>critical effect</color>.

Name: Changyu
Content: When your other attributes already have bonuses, a high <color=#57f0fb>Critical</color> will bring you remarkable benefits. Remember to keep boosting your attributes!

Name: Changyu
Content: Here's the <color=#57f0fb>Item Rating</color> of this collectible. The higher the Item Rating, the higher the bonuses it provides to this item!

Name: Leonie
Content: Time is of the essence. Select a stage to start this operation!

Name: Celica
Content: Welcome to <color=#57f0fb>Corrupted Battlefront - Pioneers of Peril</color>. In this event, you need to utilize the characters' new abilities to complete the challenges.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap here to view character details and switch between characters.

Name: Celica
Content: Let's start with a <color=#57f0fb>tutorial stage</color>, Commandant.

Name: Celica
Content: Tap here to enter Battle Preparations and select the <color=#57f0fb>Armament and Core</color> to bring into the operation.

Name: Celica
Content: Before starting a challenge, adjust the Core and Armament to maximize your combat efficiency.

Name: Celica
Content: Babylonia will give out some magazines <color=#57f0fb>every day</color>. Use them to increase your character's BP.

Name: Celica
Content: Let's go into action now, Commandant.

Name: Lilith
Content: Welcome to Loprados. This is our latest game, <color=#57f0fb>Constellation of Chess</color>, a battle of luck and wits.

Name: Lilith
Content: Will Lady Luck smile upon you? I'll explain the game rules now.

Name: Lilith
Content: Let's start with some warm-up exercises. First, select <color=#57f0fb>Opening - Tutorial I</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Here are the <color=#57f0fb>Starting Pieces</color> of this game.

Name: Lilith
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>number of challenge missions and stage objectives</color> of this game are shown here.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap <color=#57f0fb>Start</color> to test your luck.

Name: Lilith
Content: The rules are easy: <color=#57f0fb>Choose</color> the <color=#57f0fb>pieces</color> to be placed on the board and <color=#57f0fb>earn high scores</color> to complete the challenge missions.

Name: Lilith
Content: This is the board. <color=#57f0fb>Only pieces that appear on the board will be counted toward the current round's score</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>base score</color> of a piece is shown in the top-left corner. Each time you finish setting the board, the piece's base score will be counted toward the game score.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap a chess piece to view <color=#57f0fb>its details</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Here is your <color=#57f0fb>game score</color>. The score you have earned after setting the board each time will be <color=#57f0fb>added up together and displayed here</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Here is your challenge mission. <color=#57f0fb>After setting the board in Round 2, the game score must be at least 15</color>. Otherwise, the challenge will fail.

Name: Lilith
Content: You can get 1 Refresh Token after completing the challenge.

Name: Lilith
Content: Before the start of each round, you have <color=#57f0fb>1 chance to replenish pieces</color>. Note that you can only choose 1 from the 3 pieces provided.

Name: Lilith
Content: Let's choose <color=#57f0fb>[A-Rank CUB] as it has a higher base score</color> and gives us higher scores in every round.

Name: Lilith
Content: After replenishing a new piece, <color=#57f0fb>the game rounds +1</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap <color=#57f0fb>[Reset]</color> to reset the board and calculate the score.

Name: Lilith
Content: After setting the board, <color=#57f0fb>the base scores of pieces on the board will be counted toward your current score</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Let's check out the special effects of different pieces.

Name: Lilith
Content: When choosing pieces, we can view <color=#57f0fb>the pieces already in your inventory</color>. Tap on the inventory to open it.

Name: Lilith
Content: Select Gold to view its details.

Name: Lilith
Content: This is the <color=#57f0fb>score you will earn after Gold is dissolved</color>. If <color=#57f0fb>Gold is dissolved</color>, we can <color=#57f0fb>earn 2 points</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: <color=#57f0fb>In each round, a Gold piece has a chance to summon another Gold</color> to the board. <color=#57f0fb>We must dissolve them quickly before they occupy the entire board</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap Back now. Let's see if we have a <color=#57f0fb>piece that can dissolve Gold</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Sophia is able to <color=#57f0fb>dissolve the Gold adjacent to her</color>. <color=#57f0fb>The entire circle</color> around Sophia is considered to be <color=#57f0fb>adjacent</color> to her.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap <color=#57f0fb>Set Board</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Sophia has just <color=#57f0fb>earned a lot of points from dissolving Gold pieces</color>. Changyu is able to summon Gold pieces to the board. Let's choose him <color=#57f0fb>to replenish more Gold for Sophia to dissolve</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Select Sophia.

Name: Lilith
Content: Each piece has <color=#57f0fb>1-3 tags</color>. Pieces with <color=#57f0fb>the same tag</color> have <color=#57f0fb>skills that will interact with each other</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: The <color=#57f0fb>quantity of pieces</color> under a particular tag is shown here. Generally, we should choose the <color=#57f0fb>tag with the most pieces</color> as the main type.

Name: Lilith
Content: We need to choose <color=#57f0fb>pieces with the corresponding tag</color>. You can also <color=#57f0fb>change your main type by adjusting the number of pieces</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Before replenishing, don't forget to check <color=#57f0fb>the pieces in your inventory</color>. Pay attention to how their skills work together.

Name: Lilith
Content: We're already at Stage 4. This time, our starting pieces are Selena and Teddy.

Name: Lilith
Content: Cheat Code grants Selena and Teddy <color=#57f0fb>3 bonus points</color> during every round's score calculation.

Name: Lilith
Content: Cheat Code <color=#57f0fb>takes effect as long as it's inside your inventory</color>! As long as you have it, it doesn't need to be on the board to take effect!

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap Set Board.

Name: Lilith
Content: Cheat Code enabled. Selena and Teddy will <color=#57f0fb>permanently get +2 base score</color> in every round.

Name: Lilith
Content: This is it!

Name: Lilith
Content: Turn on Speed-Up to accelerate the calculation of scores.

Name: Lilith
Content: Here it comes! Could it be your lucky piece, Luckless Commandant? Its skill has <color=#57f0fb>a certain chance to turn you into a Lucky Commandant</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Hmm? Are you expecting something? Just pick it. It won't go wrong.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap Set Board and see if you are lucky.

Name: Lilith
Content: You have become a <color=#57f0fb>Lucky Commandant</color>! Not bad, you can keep enjoying your luck bonus.

Name: Lilith
Content: The pieces have taken up the entire board! Is there something wrong with this machine? Don't you dare slam the case!

Name: Lilith
Content: A new option, "Delete Piece", has been added! We can now <color=#57f0fb>choose to either replenish 1 piece or delete 1 piece</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Select the <color=#57f0fb>Delete Piece</color> tag.

Name: Lilith
Content: We can <color=#57f0fb>select any 1 piece to delete it</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: I see the logo of Gray Raven! Let's see what effects this one has.

Name: Lilith
Content: When <color=#57f0fb>a Gray Raven member and Gray Raven's Logo are both on the board, you will earn lots of points</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: There are 21 pieces in the inventory, but <color=#57f0fb>the board has only 20 slots</color>. To ensure a Gray Raven member and Gray Raven's Logo are both on the board, we need to <color=#57f0fb>delete 1 piece</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Cog has a low base score. <color=#57f0fb>Delete 1 Cog</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap Delete.

Name: Lilith
Content: Confirm deletion.

Name: Lilith
Content: Now we have one less piece. You can also <color=#57f0fb>use a Delete Token in the inventory to delete a piece</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: 1 Delete Token is required to delete a piece from the inventory. <color=#57f0fb>You can get Delete Tokens by completing in-game challenge missions</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: We are getting more and more <color=#57f0fb>CUBs</color>. Buddy's skill can dissolve them.

Name: Lilith
Content: Select <color=#57f0fb>Buddy</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Hah, <color=#57f0fb>Celica</color> has shown up. Her skill is extremely powerful. Maybe today really is your lucky day.

Name: Lilith
Content: This piece doesn't appear very often! Keep exploring, Commandant.

Name: Lilith
Content: Shark-speare? It looks like a formidable foe, but you can easily defeat it if <color=#57f0fb>you have a combat character with a base score of 15 or above</color> on the board!

Name: Lilith
Content: We need to increase the combat character's base score to 15 or above. There are many weapons on the board, which we can use to <color=#57f0fb>boost the base score of combat characters</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Nice, here comes a <color=#57f0fb>combat character, Alpha</color>. Let's use her to dissolve the weapons on the board and boost her base score.

Name: Lilith
Content: Select Alpha.

Name: Lilith
Content: Next, <color=#57f0fb>select as many weapons as we can</color> to boost Alpha's base score.

Name: Lilith
Content: There are many <color=#57f0fb>Goofballs</color> on the board. When <color=#57f0fb>a Goofball is adjacent to Punishing Virus</color>, it can immediately be <color=#57f0fb>converted into a low-level enemy</color>.

Name: Lilith
Content: Did the enemies scare you? Sometimes, you can also <color=#57f0fb>use the enemy</color> to achieve desirable outcomes. I'll show you how to do so.

Name: Lilith
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Mother can devour low-level enemies to increase her base score</color>, so we should create low-level enemies to feed her.

Name: Lilith
Content: Therefore, we should select <color=#57f0fb>Punishing Virus</color> to provide Mother with more low-level enemies.

Name: Lilith
Content: There are too many Goofballs in the inventory. We are running out of Punishing Virus. Use <color=#57f0fb>Lazer</color> to dissolve Goofballs and earn bonus points.

Name: Lilith
Content: We need <color=#57f0fb>Lazer</color> to dissolve Goofballs! Select Lazer.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Insatiable Research</color> is now available. You can <color=#57f0fb>obtain S-Rank Amplifier Construct Lilith: Mirage for free</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: Select the Insatiable Research tab.

Name: Celica
Content: Complete missions to obtain <color=#57f0fb>Insatiable Research Regular R&D Tickets</color>.

Name: Celica
Content: Commandant, <color=#57f0fb>Insatiable Research - Limited</color> is now available.

Name: Celica
Content: A new feature of <color=#57f0fb>Preparation</color> can be unlocked. Go check it out, Commandant.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Armament</color> can change your default Gun Skill or provide powerful buffs.

Name: Celica
Content: Clear certain Trace Journey stages to unlock the purchase accesses of corresponding Armaments.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Core</color> is your powerful active skill. Casting it requires Signature Energy.

Name: Celica
Content: Use <color=#57f0fb>Magazines</color> to purchase unlocked Preparation items. You can access Preparation from the character interface or change them at any time on the Preparation interface.

Name: Celica

Content: Clear certain Trace Journey stages to unlock the purchase accesses of corresponding Armaments.

Name: Celica
Content: <color=#57f0fb>Core</color> is your powerful active skill. Casting it requires Signature Energy.

Name: Celica
Content: Use <color=#57f0fb>Magazines</color> to purchase unlocked Preparation items. You can access Preparation from the character interface or change them at any time on the Preparation interface.

Name: Lilith
Content: Looks like you aren't happy with the base scores of these pieces. <color=#57f0fb>Use</color> the <color=#57f0fb>Refresh Token</color> you got from challenge missions to refresh the pieces.

Name: Lilith
Content: Refresh completed. <color=#57f0fb>Sophia</color> has a base score of 4.

Name: Lilith
Content: Tap <color=#57f0fb>Set Board</color> to calculate the score of Round 3.

Name: Lilith
Content: Select <color=#57f0fb>Sophia</color>.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Action Points have been restored. Head toward the regional battle target!

Name: Rosetta
Content: Carefully consider the order of your actions and earn Silver Coins from various events, then defeat the Boss to clear the stage.

Name: Rosetta
Content: Welcome to the <color=#57f0fb>Lost Silver City</color>. Due to the curse of the queen, you can only eliminate the enemies here through Proxy Battle.

Name: Rosetta
Content: When you have insufficient Silver Coins, you may retain some Action Points. <color=#57f0fb>Each Action Point will be converted into 100 Silver Coins</color> when results are calculated.
